<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold">&#xA0; <font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Exhibit
31.1</font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
FORM OF CERTIFICATION</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
PURSUANT TO RULE 13a-14 AND 15d-14</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
UNDER THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AS AMENDED</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
CERTIFICATION</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">I,
Stephen T. Chen, certify that:</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">1.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;I
have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Amarillo
Biosciences, Inc.;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">2.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement
of material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such
statements were made, not misleading with respect to the periods
covered by this report;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">3.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial
information included in this report, fairly present in all material
respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash
flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in
this report;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">4.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;The
registrant&#x2019;s other certifying officer and I are responsible
for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures
(as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and
internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange
Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))for the registrant and
have:</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(a)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
ensure that material information relating to the registrant,
including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by
others within those entities, particularly during the period in
which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(b)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;
&#xA0; Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or
caused such internal control over financial reporting to be
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the
preparation of financial statements for external purposes in
accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(c)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant&#x2019;s disclosure controls and
procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the
effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the
end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation;
and</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(d)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant&#x2019;s internal
control over financial reporting that occurred during the
registrant&#x2019;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the
registrant&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting;
and</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 48px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">5.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;The
registrant&#x2019;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed,
based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over
financial reporting, to the registrant&#x2019;s auditors and the
audit committee of the registrant&#x2019;s board of directors (or
persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(a)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or
operation of internal control over financial reporting which are
reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#x2019;s
ability to record, process, summarize, and report financial
information; and</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 96px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(b)&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other
employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#x2019;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">

<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
Date: March 30, 2021</font></div>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-33.1
<SEQUENCE>8
<FILENAME>amar_ex331.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<!-- Document created using Blueprint(R) - powered by Issuer Direct - www.issuerdirect.com -->
<!-- Copyright 2021 Issuer Direct Corporation -->
<title>amar_ex331</title>
</head>
<body style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px;">
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-right: 0px">
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: left; width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold"><font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Exhibit
33.1</font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
CERTIFICATION REPORT</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
Management&#x2019;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial
Reporting</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Management
is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal
control over financial reporting of the Company. Internal control
over financial reporting is a process designed to provide
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial
reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external
purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally
accepted in the United States of America.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">The
Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting includes
those policies and procedures that (i) pertain to the maintenance
of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly
reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the
Company; (ii) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are
recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements
in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the
United States of America, and that receipts and expenditures of the
Company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of
management and directors of the Company; and (iii) provide
reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of
unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the
Company&#x2019;s assets that could have a material effect on the
financial statements.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Because
of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial
reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also,
projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods
are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because
of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the
policies or procedures may deteriorate.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Management
conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of internal control
over financial reporting based on the framework in Internal
Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of
Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). Based
on this evaluation, management concluded that the Company&#x2019;s
internal control over financial reporting was not effective as of
December 31, 2020.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
<tr>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 34%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
Date: March 30, 2021</font></div>
</td>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 7%">
<div><font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
</td>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 59%; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-style: italic; color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;/s/ Stephen T.
Chen</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 34%">
<div><font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
</td>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 7%">
<div><font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
</td>
<td style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 59%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
Stephen T. Chen, Chairman of the Board,</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.1
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>amar_ex991.htm
<DESCRIPTION>906 CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<!-- Document created using Blueprint(R) - powered by Issuer Direct - www.issuerdirect.com -->
<!-- Copyright 2021 Issuer Direct Corporation -->
<title>amar_ex991</title>
</head>
<body style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px;">
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-right: 0px">
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: left; width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">&#xA0;
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">Exhibit
99.1</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-weight: bold; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">
SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">In
connection with the Annual Report of Amarillo Biosciences, Inc. on
Form 10-K for the period ended December 31, 2019 as filed with the
Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the
&#x201C;Report&#x201D;), the undersigned, in the capacity and on the
date indicated below, hereby certifies pursuant to 18 U.S.C.
Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of his
knowledge:</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="display: table-cell; width: 48px"><font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">1.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0;</font></div>

    <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization and Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Amarillo Biosciences, Inc. (the &amp;#34;Company&amp;#34;&#13;or &amp;#34;the Company&amp;#34;), is a diversified healthcare company engaged in the discovery and development of pharmaceutical and&#13;biotech products. The Company is a Texas corporation which was formed in 1984.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company primarily operates through three&#13;divisions:&amp;#160; Pharmaceutical, Medical and Consumer.&amp;#160; The Pharmaceutical division leverages our data library by applying&#13;the Company's experience in the use of low-dose non-injectable interferon (IFN) for the treatment of neoplastic, viral, and fibrotic&#13;diseases. The Company seeks to engage in patent licensing and commercialization opportunities with global partners. The Medical&#13;division is focused on medical devices and developing technology to treat metabolism related diseases such as Type 1 and Type&#13;2 diabetes in Asia.&amp;#160; The Consumer division includes a range of nutraceutical and food supplement products that utilize a&#13;liposomal delivery system.&amp;#160; The Company currently has offices in the United States and Taiwan.&amp;#160; The Company operates&#13;in Taiwan under the name AMARILLO BIOSCIENCES, INC. TAIWAN BRANCH.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Going Concern&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;These financial statements have been prepared&#13;in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles (U.S. GAAP), on a going concern basis, which contemplates&#13;the realization of assets and the satisfaction of liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. The Company has&#13;not yet achieved operating income, and its operations are funded primarily from debt and equity financings. However, losses are&#13;anticipated in the ongoing development of its business and there can be no assurance that the Company will be able to achieve or&#13;maintain profitability.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The continuing operations of the Company and&#13;the recoverability of the carrying value of assets is dependent upon the ability of the Company to obtain necessary financing to&#13;fund its working capital requirements, and upon future profitable operations. The accompanying financial statements do not include&#13;any adjustments relative to the recoverability and classification of asset carrying amounts or the amount and classification of&#13;liabilities that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;There can be no assurance that capital will&#13;be available as necessary to meet the Company&amp;#8217;s working capital requirements or, if the capital is available, that it will&#13;be on terms acceptable to the Company. The issuances of additional equity securities by the Company may result in dilution in the&#13;equity interests of its current stockholders. Obtaining commercial loans, assuming those loans would be available, will increase&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s liabilities and future cash commitments. If the Company is unable to obtain financing in the amounts and on&#13;terms deemed acceptable, the business and future success may be adversely affected and the Company may cease operations. These&#13;factors raise substantial doubt regarding our ability to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Under the Financial Account Standards Board&#13;Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;FASB ASC&amp;#8221;), we are permitted to elect to measure financial instruments and certain&#13;other items at fair value, with the change in fair value recorded in earnings.&amp;#160;We elected not to measure any eligible items&#13;using the fair value option. Consistent with Fair Value Measurement Topic of the FASB ASC, we implemented guidelines relating to&#13;the disclosure of our methodology for periodic measurement of our assets and liabilities recorded at fair market value.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Fair value is defined as the price that would&#13;be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement&#13;date.&amp;#160;A three-tier fair value hierarchy prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair value.&amp;#160;The hierarchy gives the&#13;highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (level 1 measurements) and the&#13;lowest priority to unobservable inputs (level 3 measurements).&amp;#160;These tiers include:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="3" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; vertical-align: top; width: 72px; padding-left: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Level 1, defined as observable inputs such as quoted prices for identical instruments in active markets;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="3" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; vertical-align: top; width: 72px; padding-left: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Level 2, defined as inputs other than quoted prices in active markets that are either directly or indirectly observable such as quoted prices for similar instruments in active markets or quoted prices for identical or similar instruments in markets that are not active; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="3" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; vertical-align: top; width: 72px; padding-left: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Level 3, defined as unobservable inputs in which little or no market data exists, therefore requiring an entity to develop its own assumptions, such as valuations derived from valuation techniques in which one more significant inputs or significant value drivers are unobservable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our Level 1 assets and liabilities primarily&#13;include our cash and cash equivalents. Valuations are obtained from readily available pricing sources for market transactions involving&#13;identical assets or liabilities.&amp;#160;The carrying amounts of accounts receivable, prepaid expense, accounts payable, accrued liabilities,&#13;advances from investors, and notes payable approximate fair value due to the immediate or short-term maturities of these financial&#13;instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Stock-Based Compensation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Stock-based compensation expense is recorded&#13;in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718, &lt;i&gt;Compensation &amp;#8211; Stock Compensation&lt;/i&gt;, for stock and stock options awarded in return&#13;for services rendered. The expense is measured at the grant-date fair value of the award and recognized as compensation expense&#13;on a straight-line basis over the service period, which is the vesting period. The Company estimates forfeitures that it expects&#13;will occur and records expense based upon the number of awards expected to vest.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company classifies investments as cash equivalents&#13;if the original maturity of an investment is three months or less.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The&amp;#160;Company's primary source of revenue&#13;is the sale of products within three business units: the Medical, Pharmaceutical, and Consumer Product Divisions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Medical division periodically provides medical&#13;equipment to metabolism treatment centers in Taiwan and Hong Kong.&amp;#160; The Consumer Product division provides nutraceuticals&#13;and food supplements in Asian markets. Revenues are recognized for both these revenue streams when an agreement is in place, the&#13;price is fixed, title for product passes to the customer or services have been provided and collectability is reasonably assured,&#13;which is generally upon delivery to the customer. Revenues are recorded net of sales taxes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Pharmaceutical Division is currently seeking&#13;to leverage the Company's intellectual property and core technology, low-dose non-injectable interferon, to expand treatment of&#13;the aforementioned neoplastic, viral, and fibrotic diseases as well as other potential indications.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Revenue recognized during the year ended December&#13;31, 2020 and 2019 was generated by the Consumer Product division&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Allowance for Doubtful Accounts&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company establishes an allowance for doubtful&#13;accounts to ensure trade and notes receivable are not overstated due to non-collectability. The Company&amp;#8217;s allowance is based&#13;on a variety of factors, including age of the receivable, significant one-time events, historical experience, and other risk considerations.&#13;The Company had no material accounts receivable and no allowance at December 31, 2020 or 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Inventory&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market. Cost is determined&#13;on a first-in, first-out basis. The Company continually assesses the appropriateness of inventory valuations giving consideration&#13;to slow-moving, non-saleable, out-of-date or close-dated inventory.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Property and equipment are stated on the basis&#13;of historical cost less accumulated depreciation. Depreciation is provided using the straight-line method over the two to seven&#13;year estimated useful lives of the assets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Patents and Patent Expenditures&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company holds patent license agreements&#13;and maintains patents that are owned by the Company. All patent license agreements remain in effect over the life of the underlying&#13;patents. Accordingly, the patent license fee is being amortized over the estimated life of the patent using the straight-line method.&#13;Patent fees and legal fees associated with the issuance of new owned patents are capitalized and amortized over the estimated 15&#13;to 20 year life of the patent. &lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;The Company continually evaluates the amortization period&#13;and carrying basis of patents to determine whether subsequent events and circumstances warrant a revised estimated useful life&#13;or impairment in value. No patent costs were written off for the years ended December 31, 2020, or December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Long-lived Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Impairment losses are recorded on long-lived&#13;assets used in operations when indicators of impairment are present and the undiscounted cash flows estimated to be generated by&#13;those assets are less than the assets' carrying amount. No impairment losses have been recorded since inception.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The asset and liability approach is used to&#13;account for income taxes by recognizing deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of temporary&#13;differences between the carrying amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities. The Company records a valuation allowance&#13;to reduce the deferred tax assets to the amount that is more likely than not to be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Research and Development&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Research and development costs are expensed&#13;as incurred. During the years ended December 31, 2020, and December 31, 2019, the Company incurred $40,389 of which $40,000 was&#13;paid in stock and $389 in cash and $52,510, respectively, in expenses towards research activities associated with the development&#13;of its proprietary pulsatile infusion treatment. Other than corporate administrative and professional accounting fees related to&#13;maintaining public listing requirements, a significant portion, if not all, of the Company&amp;#8217;s Selling, General &amp;#38; Administrative&#13;expenss were also allocated towards the research and development of the Company&amp;#8217;s proprietary pulsatile insulin treatment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in conformity&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions&#13;that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the&#13;financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ&#13;from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basic and Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;As of December 31, 2020, potentially dilutive shares of 678,726 are&#13;not included in the calculation of fully diluted net loss per share as the effect with a net loss would be antidilutive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Financial instruments that potentially subject&#13;the Company to significant concentration of credit risk consist principally of cash. The Company has cash balances in a single&#13;U.S. financial institution which, from time to time, could exceed the federally insured limit of $250,000. The Company maintains&#13;multiple accounts in its Taiwan Branch office which help to mitigate risk. As of December 31, 2020, cash held in Taiwan accounts&#13;amounted to $3,671. No loss has been incurred related to the aforementioned concentration of cash.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Recent accounting pronouncements issued by the&#13;FASB, its Emerging Issues Task Force, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, and the Securities and Exchange Commission&#13;did not or are not believed by management to have a material impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s present or future financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 27pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Property, equipment and software are&#13;stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and consist of the following at December 31, 2020 and 2019:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: center"&gt;2020&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: center"&gt;2019&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 56%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;Furniture and equipment&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 8%; font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 12%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;94,625&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 1%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 8%; font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 12%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;94,625&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 1%; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Automobiles&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The notes are unsecured and are due on demand.&#13;All shares issued on conversion are to be restricted subject to Rule 144 promulgated under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933. The&#13;Company may prepay the notes in whole or in part at any time without penalty. The convertible notes due to Dr. Chen are related&#13;party notes. See footnote 5.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As discussed in Note 4, as of December 31, 2020&#13;and 2019, the Company has convertible notes payable of $953,001 and $444,581, respectively. Interest expense related to these notes&#13;for 2020 and 2019 was $9,892 and $4,094, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Dr. Chen is an officer and Director of the Company.&#13;Furthermore, he beneficially owns over 10% of the issued and outstanding stock. Dr. Chen is, therefore, considered a related party.&#13;The total related party promissory notes for 2020, were $805,001 as compared to $428,581 in 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The shareholders have authorized 100,000,000&#13;shares of voting common shares for issuance. On December 31, 2020, a total of 50,783,942 shares of common stock were either issued&#13;(42,066,172), reserved for conversion of convertible debt to stock (3,608,153), held for future exercise of stock options (4,657,000)12&#13;and warrants (452,617).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 6, 2020, 400,000 shares were issued&#13;at the price of $0.25 per share for the investment of $100,000 in the Company&amp;#8217;s2019-2 Private Placement Stock Offering. The&#13;investment funds were received on December 31, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On October 1, 2020, 100,000 shares were issued&#13;to UHO Wellness Corporation (UHO) pursuant to a stock for services agreement executed by the Company and UHO on February 13, 2020.&#13;The shares were issued at $0.22 per share for preparation and submission of a Taiwan patent application for the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;SMART technology. On December 1, 2020, the Company issued 100,000 shares at $0.18 per share to UHO when the aforementioned patent&#13;was issued. Issuance of the patent and payment of the shares signified fulfillment of the agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;12 of the total options granted (4,657,000), 1,912,800 are vested&#13;as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 30, 2020, 54,780 common shares were&#13;issued to the Company&amp;#8217;s legal consultant as part of the engagement contract for services for the fiscal year 2019. The total&#13;amount of the stock was $14,440. Also on December 30, 2021, 158,528 shares were issued to the Company&amp;#8217;s executive consultant&#13;for advisory services rendered as part of the engagement contract for 2019 and 2020. The total amount of the stock was $42,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 30, 2020, Dr. Stephen T. Chen, Ph.D.,&#13;CEO, received 651,701 as compensation in the amount of $175,000 for 2019 and 2020. Also on December 30, 2020, Bernard Cohen, VP,&#13;received 78,203 shares as compensation of $21,000 for 2019 and 2020. Dr. Celee Spidel, former Medical Liaison, received 6,304 common&#13;shares for compensation of $2,250 for 2019&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 1.5pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On May 11, 2020, the Company Board&#13;of Directors unanimously approved a Consent Resolution enacting the 2020-1 Private Placement Memorandum and Subscription of Non-Distributive&#13;Intent (PPM Offering) (2020-1 Private Placement Package). The offering was approved for the sale of a maximum of 5,208,334 shares&#13;to raise an aggregate amount not to exceed $1,000,000. The stated use of proceeds was for commercialization of technologies and&#13;application of funds to operating expenses as necessary. The offering was to be completed not later than July 31, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 1.5pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On November 30, 2020, the Company&#13;Board of Directors approved the extension of the 2020-1 Private Placement Package until March 31, 2021. With the exception of the&#13;new closing date, all terms and conditions of the 2021-1 Private Placement Package remain the same as disclosed in the previous&#13;paragraph.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 18, 2020, the Company Board of Directors&#13;approved an increase in the amount of authorized shares for issuance from 100 million common shares to 300 million common shares&#13;contingent upon transaction close of the Securities Purchase Agreement with Ainos, Inc. Pursuant to this Agreement, the Company&#13;will acquire Patent Assets by issuing 100,000,000 shares of common stock valued at $0.20 to Ainos, Inc.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 1.5pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company did not pay any dividends&#13;to its common stock shareholders in 2020 and has no plans to do so in the immediate future.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 1.5pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Amarillo Biosciences, Inc. uses the&#13;services of American Stock Transfer and Trust Company as the Company&amp;#8217;s transfer agent.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
    <AMAR:PreferredStockDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The shareholders have authorized 10,000,000&#13;shares of preferred stock shares for issuance.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;No Preferred Equity was outstanding as of December&#13;31, 2020 and 2019 and none is outstanding as of the date of this report.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</AMAR:PreferredStockDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 26, 2018, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board&#13;of Directors adopted the Amarillo Biosciences, Inc., 2018 Employee Stock Option Plan (the &amp;#8220;2018-ESOP&amp;#8221;). The 2018-ESOP&#13;provides for the grant of Qualified Incentive Stock Options to the Company&amp;#8217;s employees. The Board, in its adoption of the&#13;2018-ESOP, directed the Officers to submit the 2018-ESOP to the shareholders for ratification and approval at the next scheduled&#13;shareholders meeting. Failure of the ratification and approval of the 2018-ESOP within one year of the effective date renders the&#13;qualified options to become nonqualified options for purposes of the U.S Internal Revenue Code. The 2018-ESOP is administered by&#13;the Board of Directors of the Company or by a committee of directors appointed by the Board of Directors of the Company (the &amp;#8220;Stock&#13;Option Committee&amp;#8221;) as constituted from time to time. The maximum number of shares of Common Stock which may be issued under&#13;the 2018-ESOP is six million (6,000,000) common stock shares which will be reserved for issuance subject to options.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The option price per share of Common Stock deliverable&#13;upon the exercise of an Incentive Stock Option is 100% of the fair market value of a share of Common Stock on the date the Incentive&#13;Stock Option is granted. The option price is $0.38 per share and the options are exercisable during a period of ten (10) years&#13;from the date of grant, where the options vest 20% annually over five (5) years, commencing one (1) year from date of grant. If&#13;an option grantee owns or controls over ten percent (10%) of the outstanding stock, then pursuant to Section 424(d) of the Code,&#13;the option price becomes 110% of fair market value, $0.418; the term of exercise becomes five (5) years from ten (10); and the&#13;vesting period decreases from five (5) years to four (4) years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Since approval of the &amp;#8220;2018-ESOP&amp;#8221;&#13;on September 26, 2018 through the date this document was filed, no stockholders meeting has been convened. As a result of the stockholders&#13;not having ratified the &amp;#8220;2018-ESOP&amp;#8221;, the qualified options automatically became non-qualified options on September&#13;26, 2019. All other terms and conditions of the plan remain the same.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 26, 2018, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board&#13;of Directors adopted the Amarillo Biosciences, Inc., 2018 Officers, Directors, Employees, and Consultants Nonqualified Stock Option&#13;Plan (the &amp;#8220;2018-NQSOP&amp;#8221;). The 2018-NQSOP provides for the grant of Nonqualified Incentive Stock Options to the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;employees. The 2018-NQSOP is administered by the Board of Directors of the Company or by the Stock Option Committee as constituted&#13;from time to time. The maximum number of shares of Common Stock which may be issued under the 2018-NQSOP is twenty million (20,000,000)&#13;common stock shares which will be reserved for issuance subject to options. The option price for the Nonqualified Options is $0.38&#13;exercisable for a period of ten (10) years, with a vesting period of five (5) years at 20% per year commencing one (1) year from&#13;date of grant. There are no changes in terms or conditions for shareholders who own or control over ten percent (10%) of the outstanding&#13;stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 18, 2020, the Board of Directors&#13;approved the termination of the 2008 Stock Incentive Plan that was previously approved by the board on May 23, 2008 and replaced&#13;with the 2018 company stock option plans that were adopted on September 26, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Equity Compensation Plan Information:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;1&lt;/b&gt; The Board of Directors has approved all stock, stock option&#13;and stock warrant issuances.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2&lt;/b&gt; On September 26, 2019, all Qualified Options became non-qualified&#13;options since the 2018-ESOP was not ratified by the stockholders.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Whether qualified or nonqualified, when options&#13;are exercised, the Company Common Stock shares will be issued pursuant to Rule 144A meaning that the shares cannot be traded or&#13;otherwise exchanged for a minimum period of six months from issue date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;A summary of option activity for the years ended December 31, 2019&#13;and December 31, 2020 are presented below.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; These totals remain separated since the two different plans are still in existence.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company used the Black-Scholes option pricing&#13;model to value the option awards with the following assumptions applied: (1) Volatility &amp;#8211; 276%; (2) Term &amp;#8211; 5 years&#13;was chosen although the full option term is 10 years to be more commensurate with the 5-year vesting portion of the plan; (3) Discount&#13;&amp;#8211; 2.96%.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of December 31, 2020, there is&#13;$924,180 in unrecognized option expense that will be recognized over the next 2.75 years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Directors, officers, employees and consultants&#13;did not exercise any options in 2019 or 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock>
    <AMAR:DisclosureOfWarrantsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On November 30, 2020, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board&#13;of Directors approved an extension of the consulting agreement and pre-existing warrant certificate between the Company and i2China&#13;Management Group, LLC, originally dated April 15, 2018. The warrant is effective from November 25, 2020, until November 25, 2025&#13;at 5:00 P.M. Central Standard Time. The warrant entitles the consultant to purchase 452,617 shares of common stock at an exercise&#13;price of $0.27 per share. The warrant was valued at $70,608 and will be expensed over sixty (60) months. The Company used the Black-Scholes&#13;option pricing model to value the warrants with the following assumptions applied: (1) Volatility &amp;#8211; 201%; (2) Term &amp;#8211;&#13;5 years (3) Discount Rate &amp;#8211;.39%.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;No warrants were exercised in 2020 or 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</AMAR:DisclosureOfWarrantsDisclosureTextBlock>

   &lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;3,725,000&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;Valuation allowance&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;(3,725,000&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#151;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-size: 8pt; padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-size: 8pt; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#151;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-size: 8pt; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;At December 31, 2020, the Company has estimated&#13;net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $24,948,000 for federal income tax purposes expiring in 2021 through 2040. The&#13;ability of the Company to utilize these carryforwards may be difficult and directly dependent upon many factors outside of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s control, including, but not limited to, changes in the legal and regulatory framework and the operational and corporate&#13;structure of the Company and shareholders, or sales or transfers of stock by or among shareholders. For example, if the Company&#13;has experienced a change of control as defined in the relevant provisions of the IRC,13 the use of any existing tax attributes&#13;could be severely limited. The Company does not believe the reorganization has or will impair any tax attributes; however, obtaining&#13;value from the tax attributes is a function of the Company&amp;#8217;s return to profitable operations and the timeframe of that return.&#13;While we believe it is possible, there is no assurance that the Company will return to profitability in the future.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of December 31, 2020, the Company had open&#13;tax years of 2020, 2019 and 2018 which are subject to examination by tax authorities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Lease commitment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our executive and administrative offices are&#13;located at 4134 Business Park Drive, Amarillo, Texas in a 1,800 square-foot leased facility. The lease term, which is a semi-annual&#13;renewal, begins on January 1 of the calendar year and expires on June 30 of the calendar year. The lease automatically renews on&#13;July 1 of the calendar year if termination notice is not given to lessor. The rent in effect on December 31, 2020 was $1,315 per&#13;month. The renewed lease for the period January 1, 2021, through March 31, 2021, has a rent cost of $1,315 per month. The monthly&#13;lease for a similarly sized office in Taiwan was $2,548 per month or $30,579 annually for a twelve-month lease.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;13 See 26 U.S.C. &amp;#167; 382 (known as Section&#13;382 of the IRC) and related regulations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Litigation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 9.75pt 0 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company is not a party to any litigation&#13;and is not aware of any pending litigation or unasserted claims or assessments as of December 31, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Officer Compensation&amp;#160;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 1, 2021, the Company entered into&#13;new employment contracts with Stephen T Chen, the Company&amp;#8217;s Chairman, CEO, President, and CFO; and with Bernard Cohen, the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s Vice-President of Administration. These new contracts replace the previous contracts which expired on December&#13;31, 2020. The new contracts began January 1, 2021, and extend through March 31, 2021, at which time each contract expires. The&#13;job descriptions, duties, titles, benefits, and compensation amounts are identical or proportionate to the expired employment agreements.&#13;Compensation for Dr. Chen is set at $20,000 per month (an annual rate of $240,000) in cash, payable bi-monthly, and $8,333.33 monthly&#13;(an annual rate of $100,000) payable in shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s unregistered, voting common stock. Compensation for Mr. Cohen&#13;is set at $70,000 per annum in $5,833.33 cash payable bi-monthly (based on the annual amount of $70,000), and $1,000 payable monthly&#13;(annualized at $12,000), payable in shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s unregistered, voting common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The contracts provide that the Employee shall&#13;devote his entire productive time, ability, attention and energies to the business of the Company. In addition, the contracts protect&#13;the property rights of the Company, including inventions and other intellectual property, trade secrets, and proprietary information.&#13;The contracts also prohibit Employees from competing directly or indirectly with the business of the Company or its controlled&#13;subsidiaries, both during the term of the contracts, and continuing for a period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2020-01-01to2020-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 1, 2021, the Company issued Note&#13;#10.21 for deferred compensation to Dr. Stephen T. Chen, Chairman, CEO, President, and CFO, in the amount of $54,150, the maximum&#13;amount of cash compensation that could be deferred for 2021. The Note is payable on April 1, 2021, and bears interest at the AFR14&#13;short-term rate of 1.85%. The note is an advancing note with a maximum limit of $54,150 whereby the Company promises to repay the&#13;aggregate Principal Amount advanced to date up to the stated maximum amount at Maturity. The Company may request and the payee&#13;shall advance up to $9,025 on the 15th and last day of each month until the note matures. The Note may be convertible in whole&#13;or in part at a conversion price of $0.25 per share into Amarillo Biosciences, Inc., Common voting stock. All shares issued are&#13;to be restricted subject to Rule 144 promulgated under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933. The Company may prepay the Note in whole&#13;or in part at any time without penalty.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 1, 2021, the Company issued Note&#13;#11.21 for deferred compensation to i2China Management Group, LLC in the amount of $33,000, the maximum amount of cash compensation&#13;that could be deferred in 2021. The Note is payable on April 1, 2021, and bears interest at the AFR15 short-term rate of 1.85%.&#13;The note is an advancing note with a maximum limit of $33,000 whereby the Company promises to repay the aggregate Principal Amount&#13;advanced to date up to the stated maximum amount at Maturity. The Company may request and the payee shall advance up to $11,000&#13;on the last day of each month until the note matures. The Note may be convertible in whole or in part at a conversion price of&#13;$0.25 per share into Amarillo Biosciences, Inc., Common voting stock. All shares issued are to be restricted subject to Rule 144&#13;promulgated under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933. The Company may prepay the Note in whole or in part at any time without penalty.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;14 Applicable Federal Rate&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;15 Applicable Federal Rate&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 1, 2021, the Company issued Note&#13;#9.21 to Dr. Chen which reduced to writing the various working capital advances through December 2020, and became the ongoing record&#13;to track future working capital advances through the Note&amp;#8217;s maturity date of April 14, 2021. The maximum aggregate value&#13;of Note #9.21 is $325,000 and carries an AFR interest rate of 0.13%. The Company may request in writing, as needed, an advance&#13;of funds, not to exceed the specified maximum amount, and the payee shall advance the requested amount until Maturity.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Following is a complete list of Convertible&#13;Notes Payable issued by the Company as of December 31, 2020, and subsequent to that Balance Sheet Date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
